messageBody:
Dear all,

It seems that for evey case, a new instance is constructed.

If this is by design, then no need for '@Before', because the before
fixure code can be put in the constructor.

I don't think it should be this way, but a single instance is shared
between all test (methods), and for each one, @Before and @After is
called.

What do you think?

Ahmed


public class TestClass {

public TestClass() {
System.out.println("Constructor");
}

@Before
public void before() {
System.out.println("Before");
}

@Test
public void test1() {
}

@Test
public void test2() {
}

@Test
public void test3() {
}
}
